articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Choe Ro Sa
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Choe Ro Sa
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of Choe Ro Sa, Kim Il Sung Prize winner and soldier-turned veteran poet, on Saturday, expressing deep condolences over her death.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Gets Familiar with Work in Various Fields
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Gets Familiar with Work in Various Fields
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Premier Choe Yong Rim acquainted himself with the work of the Jangsan Mine on the spot on Friday.
					  He was accompanied by Jo Pyong Ju, vice-premier and minister of Machine-Building Industry, and officials concerned.
					
					 The premier opened a consultative meeting of officials in the relevant field on the spot.
					
					 The meeting emphasized the important role played by the mine in producing refractory and focused on the discussion of ways for modernizing the mine to increase production as required by the drive to push back the frontiers of science and technology and took relevant measures.
					
					 Earlier, the premier learned about the work at the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex and at various commercial and catering units in Pyongyang.
					
					 A consultative meeting held at the complex took measures for increasing the production of rails as required by the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea for modernizing the railways and introducing heavy rails.
					
					 Visiting various commercial and catering units in Pyongyang, the premier took practical steps to make sure that those units play a substantial role in improving the people's standard of living.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Prize Conferred upon Editorial Writer
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Prize Conferred upon Editorial Writer
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly promulgated a decree dated March 10 on awarding Kim Il Sung Prize to Song Mi Ran, editorial writer of Rodong Sinmun. 
					 She wrote a lot of good articles carrying philosophical weight which correctly reflected the ideas and intentions of the party true to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il, thus greatly contributing to powerfully encouraging the party members, servicepersons and working people in the drive to build a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Commemorative Stamp Issued
articles.content:
Commemorative Stamp Issued 
						
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK issued a stamp to commemorate the 65th anniversary of the first stamp in the country after its liberation from the Japanese colonial rule.
					 Since President Kim Il Sung accomplished the historical cause of national liberation on August 15, Juche 34 (1945), the mail service has steadily developed in the country.
					
					 Seen in the new stamp are pictures of the DPRK flag, a magnolia (national flower) blossoms and the first stamp "Samsonam" brought out on March 12, Juche 35 (1946).

articles.title: White Apricot of Hoeryong
articles.content:
White Apricot of Hoeryong
Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Hoeryong City in North Hamgyong Province in the northern part of the DPRK is famous for white apricot.
					 In the season of white apricot blossom, Hoeryong and neighboring people used to float flower petals on Hoeryong and Palul streams, hoping for good fortune.
					
					 The white apricot has a good taste and great efficacy for the prevention of cancer and aging as well as inappetence from pregnancy.
					
					 It is also good material of traditional homemade dishes.
					
					 The white apricot is one of Hoeryong's three beauties together with womanly beauty and clay for ceramics.

articles.title: Dagger, Gift from Russian Political Party
articles.content:
Dagger, Gift from Russian Political Party
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Exhibited at the International Friendship Exhibition House of the DPRK is a dagger sent to General Secretary Kim Jong Il by the Central Committee of the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks, Russia in Juche 87 (1998).
					 The general secretary and other leading officials of the party prepared the gift out of their respect for Kim Jong Il, a great champion of world peace.
					
					 The dagger has grooved decorations patterned with waves in the grasp.
					
					 Seen in the case of the dagger are letters "To Comrade Marshal Kim Jong Il, from the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks" written in Russian language.

articles.title: Sculpture Group of Mansudae Art Studio
articles.content:
Sculpture Group of Mansudae Art Studio
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- The sculpture group of the Mansudae Art Studio has greatly contributed to building many monuments at home and abroad.
					 Sculptors of the group rendered services to building the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo Memorial Tower, Samjiyon Grand Monument, Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery, Chollima Statue, Tower of the Juche Idea, Arch of Triumph, Monument to the West Sea Barrage and Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower.
					
					 They have also helped Senegal, Angola, Democratic Congo, Namibia, Chad and other countries in monument projects.

articles.title: KCNA Terms S. Korean Chief Executive's Talk about Dialogue Hypocritical
articles.content:
KCNA Terms S. Korean Chief Executive's Talk about Dialogue Hypocritical 
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- The chief executive of south Korea in a recent public appearance said "We are fully ready to have a dialogue with the north with open-heartedness".
					 In a nutshell, his utterance cannot but arouse derision. 
					
					 It was none other than the present chief executive who brought the inter-Korean relations to the worst phase, far from seeking true dialogue. He, however, asserts that he wants to have dialogue whenever an opportunity presents itself. Who on earth will believe this.
					
					 It is known to everybody that he has talked a lot about dialogue since the very day of his seizure of power.
					
					 No sooner had he come to power than he let loose rhetoric that "the door to dialogue is open anywhere and any time". In the next year, he uttered "we are ready to start dialogue and cooperation at any level any time as regards all matters between the south and the north." Last year he vociferated about dialogue and peace, saying "we should set peaceful unification as a target to terminate the state of division".
					
					 The DPRK issued a joint statement of its government, political parties and organizations containing an important proposal for having wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations with political parties and organizations of south Korea including its authorities this year and  took positive steps one after another to realize it. But the south Korean authorities persistently sidestepped it and brought to rupture the preliminary talks for the opening of the north-south high-level military talks. They took issue with the DPRK, crying out for "a change in attitude" and the like.
					
					 As well known to the world, eye-opening events hardly imaginable in the past took place one after another between the north and the south after the publication of the historic June 15 joint declaration the main idea of which is "By our nation itself." 
					
					 Dialogues and contacts were brisk not only between the authorities of the north and the south but between non-governmental bodies, making a breach in the barrier which has kept the nation divided into two for more than half a century and bringing about big progress in the cooperation for the prosperity common to the nation.
					
					 The dialogues and contacts between the north and the south that brought all the Koreans great courage and hope for the country's reunification, peace and prosperity were suspended with the emergence of the present regime.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations rapidly deteriorated and reached an extreme phase.
					
					  From the outset the south Korean puppet forces had no true will for dialogue.
					
					 They advocated dialogue as they could not turn their faces away from the unanimous wishes of the people at home and abroad for the development of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 That is why the south Korean people of various social standings are becoming vocal chiding the authorities' behavior. They said: "Isn't the south-north dialogue a dead language to be formally used at commemorations only? Otherwise, dialogue would not be used to rhetorically finish addresses for the past three years, instead of using it for mending the strained inter-Korean relations."
					
					 The "same nation" and "dialogue" touted by the chief executive while the DPRK-targeted joint military exercises were under way together with outside forces are a serious mockery of the compatriots and hypocrisy.
					
					 The hypocritical talk about dialogue is too disgusting to hear.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Advantages of Socialism and Development of IT
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Advantages of Socialism and Development of IT
Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses which regards collectivism as its life and soul is a society dynamically propelling the development of IT in the 21st century. Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a signed article dedicated to the 10th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The 21st Century, the New Century, Is the IT Age."
					 The work, published on March 11, Juche 90 (2001), clarifies the essence and characteristics of the IT age and its role in making socio-economic progress, the tasks and ways to develop IT.
					
					 The article refers to the achievements made by the Korean people in the drive to develop the nation's IT over the past decade since the publication of the work.
					
					  It goes on:
					
					 The true advantages of Korean-style socialism lie in that the development of science and technology and IT precisely leads to the promotion of the people's wellbeing.
					
					 Thanks to the benefit of the universal eleven-year compulsory education all children are given an ample opportunity of learning according to their aptitude and talents and growing stoutly as conquerors of latest technology under the well-regulated system for training talented persons.
					
					 Unified plans for developing IT are worked out and state investment in the IT field has systematically increased thanks to the state function as an economic organizer. The state makes sure that talented scientists and technicians fully display their wisdom and skills at right posts and all the domains of the national economy form production organism to dynamically push forward the drive for putting the national economy on a modern and IT basis. There is an increasing number of industrial establishments where production processes are placed on an IT and flexibility basis and varieties of products are diversified, which may characterize the cutting-edge industry in the age of knowledge-based economy.
					
					 The further IT develops, the deeper the capitalist society finds itself in the mire of ruin whereas Korean-style socialism of Juche under which everything serves the people is winning one victory after another.

articles.title: US-S. Korean Warmongers' Saber-rattling against DPRK Blasted
articles.content:
US-S. Korean Warmongers' Saber-rattling against DPRK Blasted
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises were staged in south Korea from February 28. They ended on March 10 but part of Foal Eagle will reportedly last till late in April.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes in a signed commentary in this regard: 
					
					 The recent joint military exercises were dangerous war maneuvers against the DPRK unprecedented in history in the light of the armed forces and war hardware involved and their contents. 
					
					 This being a hard reality, the U.S. and south Korean warmongers claimed that Key Resolve and Foal Eagle were "annual ones for defense" in a bid to mislead the public opinion at home and abroad. But this is nothing but sheer sophism intended to cover up their criminal ambition for invading the DPRK and their true colors as belligerent elements.
					
					 They were very dangerous plays with fire as they were aimed to mount a three-dimensional surprise attack on the DPRK with nukes and all other means under the simulated conditions of "contingency".
					
					 Nothing is more foolish than an attempt of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities to get something through military threat and pressure on the DPRK.
					
					 They would be well advised to stop at once their acts as reckless as jumping into fire with fagot on their back.

articles.title: Halt to US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Urged
articles.content:
Halt to US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Urged
 Pyongyang, March 12 -- The Indian Association of Mediapersons in its statement on Mar. 7 bitterly denounced Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises of the U.S. and south Korean warmongers with huge aggressor armed forces involved and demanded a halt to them. 
					 The statement went on:
					
					 This saber-rattling is the U.S. exercises for a war of aggression against the DPRK aimed to bring the whole of the Korean Peninsula under its military control in order to pressurize the east of the Asian continent. It is the exercises for a nuclear war involving huge nuclear attack means of the U.S. according to the operation plan for a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK.
					
					 This is a grave military provocation to drive the situation to the brink of war despite the proposal of the DPRK to defuse the tension on the peninsula through dialogue.
					
					 We extend firm solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to ensure peace and stability on the peninsula and achieve the reunification of the country.

articles.title: Damage by Foot-and-Mouth Diseases Increases in S. Korea
articles.content:
Damage by Foot-and-Mouth Diseases Increases in S. Korea
Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- "The damage done by foot-and-mouth diseases for the last 100 days since their occurrence is too serious", said KBS of south Korea on March 8. 
					It went on: The diseases that broke out in Andong, North Kyongsang Province, swept the whole area, leading to the cull and burial of 3.47 million heads of animals. As result, the stockbreeding field looks like a family in mourning.
					
					This huge damage was caused because the authorities carelessly approached the early stage of their occurrence. 
					
					Moreover, the authorities failed to thoroughly bury the culled animals, causing environmental pollution, the radio deplored.

articles.title: Actions against Unpopular Labor Policy Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions against Unpopular Labor Policy Launched in S. Korea
Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) and its affiliated organizations at a news conference in Seoul on March 7 declared that they would launch actions against the authorities' unpopular labor policy. 
					They in a press release deplored that part-time workers are not paid even minimum wages due to the authorities' misrule. 
					
					Women workers, in particular, have been subject to unfair treatment as regards jobs and wages since the emergence of the present regime, undergoing double and treble pain. 
					
					The organizations called for having their demands for wage hike and improved labor conditions met through actions. 
					
					The Women's Union under KCTU held a meeting in Seoul on the same day to declare its actions for winning the rights of the women workers.

articles.title: S. Korea Hit by Forest Fires
articles.content:
S. Korea Hit by Forest Fires 
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Different parts of south Korea were hit by forest fires on March 9, causing serious damage, KBS of south Korea said. 
					 The fire that broke out on a hillock of Haenam County, South Jolla Province, rapidly spread by strong wind, reducing 20,000 square meters of forest in Koksong County to ashes. 
					
					 6,000 square meters of forest were burnt in Nyongwol County, Kangwon Province of south Korea. 
					
					 On the day, Ulsan and five other parts of south Korea were hit by forest fires, causing big damage.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities' National Discrimination Assailed
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities' National Discrimination Assailed
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Students of Kobe Korean High School launched a protest action on March 3 against the Japanese authorities' unfair national discrimination. 
					 They held that the issue of applying the tuition-waiver program to the Korean schools is not a matter of money but an issue related to national dignity. 
					
					 They urged the Japanese government to properly understand the validity of the national education and lift the unfair policy of discrimination.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises under Fire Abroad
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises under Fire Abroad
Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- The Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and the DPRK made public a statement on Mar. 3 in denunciation of the war moves of the U.S. and south Korean warmongers. 
					 The statement denounced the military provocations increasing the tension on the Korean Peninsula and demanded the U.S. and the south Korean authorities stop at once the joint military exercises. 
					
					 The reality clearly shows why the south Korean authorities deliberately torpedoed the preliminary talks for opening the north-south high-level military talks, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The reality also testifies to the fact that the U.S. is the arch criminal blocking the denuclearization of the peninsula while introducing nuclear attack means to south Korea and its vicinity under the pretence of the military exercises. 
					
					 It is our belief that the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea is sure to be achieved. 
					
					 The Working Citizens' Association of Democratic Congo also released a statement on Mar. 4 condemning the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet authorities for staging the joint military exercises. 
					
					 The statement expressed expectation that all the governments and people of Asia and the rest of the world would extend positive support and solidarity to the Korean people in their efforts to defuse the danger of war and defend peace on the peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet Homepage
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet Homepage
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Abuses of Socialism Are Intolerable" was posted on the Internet homepage by the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on March 1.
					 The work, published on March 1, Juche 82 (1993), lays bare the reactionary nature and absurdity of sophism made by the imperialists and renegades of socialism slandering socialism as "totalitarian," "barracks-like" and "administrative and commanding".
					
					 It also clarifies the principled matters arising in defending and accomplishing the cause of socialism, including the issues of regarding it as faith and a moral duty to defend socialism and giving full play to its advantages.

articles.title: Pro-Japanese Humiliating Action of S. Korea under Fire
articles.content:
Pro-Japanese Humiliating Action of S. Korea under Fire
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed recently in south Korea that the puppet group changed by stealth  the letter "Tokdo" (Tok Islets) into "Tonghae" (East Sea) in the name of a marine scientific base to be built in the waters around Tok Islets, sparking off public furor. 
					 The first vice-minister of Land and Seas in charge of the base construction, when questioned at a session of "the National Assembly" on March 8 as regards the change of the name, tried to dodge the responsibility for it, saying the base has been called East Sea Comprehensive Marine Science Base since November of 2009. 
					
					 But, it was disclosed that various data released by the group for measures for managing Tok Islets last year and this year contained the expression of "Tokdo" as regards the name of the base. This touched off criticism, raising questions as to "Didn't the authorities read the face of Japan" and "Didn't they change the name for fear of diplomatic friction with Japan". He replied: "It is hard to say there was not such part."
					
					 The ministers of Foreign Affairs and Trade and Land and Sea were reported to have boycotted the meeting, feeling guilty. 
					
					  As seen above, the authorities are keen to please Japan becoming evermore undisguised in their ambition to grab Tok Islets as the days go by. This behavior is touching off bitter anger among people of various circles in south Korea.

articles.title: Barbarity Committed by US Forces Newly Disclosed
articles.content:
Barbarity Committed by US Forces Newly Disclosed
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Recently, a barbarity committed by the U.S. forces in the Guantanamo prison was disclosed, arousing serious concern by the international community. 
					 A German citizen of Turkey origin some days ago contributed to the German newspaper Berliner Zeitung about the tests conducted by U.S. forces on living bodies in the prison. He had been detained for more than four years in the prison to witness the tests. 
					
					 The U.S. forces there several times injected medicines to his body and others forcefully, he said. 
					
					 It caused abnormal symptoms among the prisoners including difficult breathing, he said, adding that such tests on living bodies are heinous torture. 
					
					 Public opinions said that U.S. forces in the past used to administer uncertain doses to prisoners and inject medicines five times more than normality and study the situation after that.

articles.title: CPLA on Promotion of Scientific Development of Unit Construction
articles.content:
Efforts of Asian Countries to Protect Forest and Ecological Environment
Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Asian countries are paying state attention to forestation and forest conservation. 
					A tree-planting campaign is being conducted as mass movements in Asian countries to increase the area of forests. 
					
					In China people from all walks of life actively take part in compulsory tree-planting. On Feb. 9 alone, more than 100,000 cadres and other people in Zhejiang Province went to the countryside to plant trees.
					
					People in Myanmar cultivate a lot of saplings of various species while all of them are encouraged to take part in the tree-planting. 
					
					Bangladesh set the goal to plant 670 million saplings of different species in the fiscal year 2010-2011 and is pushing ahead with the work to attain it. 
					
					Indonesia plans to plant trees in 300,000-400,000 hectares of land this year. It increases the area of tree nurseries to massively raise saplings of various species. 
					
					Asian countries are energetically pushing forward the work to prevent desertification of land, regarding it as part of the work for protecting ecological environment. 
					
					The Inner Mongolian Autonomous Region of China planted a lot of trees in the 260 million wu of desert for the last decade. 
					
					Jordan is planting trees of various species in about 400 square kilometers of desert between its capital and Akaba, its southern port. 
					
					The Mongolian government started planting more than 950 million trees in about 1,000 km-long section from 2005 in a bid to build "green wall."

articles.title: Russian Vice-FM Rejects Japan's Accusation
articles.content:
Russian Vice-FM Rejects Japan's Accusation
 Moscow, March 10 (KCNA) -- Russian Vice Foreign Minister Aleksei Borodavkin rejected Japan's remarks about the Southern Kuriles at a recent interview with a Russian magazine.
					 Japan chided the Russian government's measures to consolidate the sovereignty over the Kuriles. In this regard, he termed the accusation "an unsuitable protest" and "undiplomatic behavior".
					
					 He held that even a continued discussion on the territorial issue under the present situation would not open a prospect.
					
					 He clarified the stand of the Russian government that the discussion on a peace treaty would be possible when Japan neither puts up preconditions nor unilaterally links them with history.

articles.title: ITAR-TASS Introduces Korean Women
articles.content:
ITAR-TASS Introduces Korean Women
Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- The women receive warm congratulations on the International Women's Day, March 8, in the DPRK, said ITAR-TASS on Tuesday.
					 There are many songs of women in the country with "Yeppuni" (pretty girl) most popular among the local people, said the Russian news agency.
					
					 Many women like servicewomen, scientists, artistes, athletes and journalists enjoy public respect for their contribution to the building of a thriving nation in the Songun era, it added. The women's holiday is celebrated in a significant way in the DPRK.

articles.title: Gathering Held in China to Mark Int'l Women's Day
articles.content:
Gathering Held in China to Mark Int'l Women's Day
 Beijing, March 10 (KCNA) -- Nearly 1,800 people gathered at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing Tuesday to celebrate the 100th anniversary of International Women's Day. 
					 Addressing the reception, Chen Zhili, vice-chairwoman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, said during the past 100 years women worldwide have been fighting unremittingly for their liberalization, progress and development.
					
					 Women have made tremendous contributions to the world's economic and social development, said Chen.

articles.title: Round-table Talks on Album "Centenary of Chinese Women's Movement" Held
articles.content:
Round-table Talks on Album "Centenary of Chinese Women's Movement" Held
						
 Beijing, March 10 (KCNA) -- Round-table talks on the publication of an album "Centenary of the Chinese women's movement" were held in Beijing on March 6.
					 Chen Zhili, vice-chairwoman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress and chairwoman of the All-China Women's Federation, in an address said that this album serves as mental wealth of the international women's movement as it records a century-long history of the Chinese women's movement.
					
					 The album is a large historic one, the first of its kind in the Chinese history of press, as it deals with the historical course in which a broad strata of Chinese women took an active part in the revolutionary movement under the leadership of the party and have devoted their efforts to the economic and social development in each period of the revolution.

articles.title: Cuban Women Play Greater Role Professionally
articles.content:
Cuban Women Play Greater Role Professionally
 Havana, March 10 (KCNA) -- Women play a greater role professionally in Cuba.
					 According to official figures, 67 percent of college graduates and over 70 percent of health and education staff members are women.
					
					 In Cuba, women represent 43.32 percent of parliament members.

articles.title: Cuba Denounces US Illegal Action
articles.content:
Cuba Denounces US Illegal Action
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Cuban Representative Juan Antonio Quintanilla in a recent meeting of the UN Human Rights Council denounced the illegal action of the U.S. for detaining five Cuban patriots in a prison of the U.S.
					 He said that the five patriots who fought against terrorism were groundlessly arrested and forced to lead a cruel and unfair prison life. 
					
					 He demanded the U.S. stop such abnormal and arbitrary action and immediately release the Cuban patriots.

articles.title: Japan Hit by Powerful Earthquake and Tsunami
articles.content:
Japan Hit by Powerful Earthquake and Tsunami
						
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Earthquake with a magnitude of 8.8 struck northeastern Japan centered on Tohoku region on Friday and then followed tsunami, throwing its many parts into great confusion.
					 According to foreign press reports, a maximum 10 meter tsunami hit its prefectures on the coasts of the Pacific Ocean, leaving paddy and non-paddy fields and roads submerged and sweeping even fishing boats and large ships to the coasts across banks.
					
					 About 300 bodies of the people presumed to drown were discovered on the seashore of Sendai City.
					
					 Earthquake caused fires in different places.
					
					 A large fire occurred at the oil bunker at Sendai Port and the Ichihara Oil Refinery in Chiba Prefecture. Forest fire broke out in Miyagi Prefecture, turning various places into a sea of fire.
					
					 Nuclear power stations stopped their operation, leaving inhabitants of 4 million families in Tokyo and its vicinity without electricity supply. 
					
					 Many houses and public buildings collapsed and the operation of vehicles and trains and airplanes was paralyzed and communications networks were cut off.
					
					 NHK and all other broadcasting services in Japan stopped the regular programs and are focusing on reporting damage caused by the earthquake.
					
					 As regards the catastrophic quake damage, the government called an emergency meeting of all ministers to discuss measures.
					
					 The quake left more than 570 people dead and over 700 missing as of the morning of Saturday.
					
					 Damage is increasing and aftershock is reported from different places.
					
					  Strong earthquake occurred even in the far-off coastal and inland areas opposite to the area where the earthquake first occurred, rapidly increasing uneasiness.
					
					 The quake, the largest-ever in the history of quake observation in Japan, and the resultant tsunami threw all areas of Japan in the state of pandemonium and quake phobia, said foreign press reports.

articles.title: Resignation of Naoto Kan Urged
articles.content:
Resignation of Naoto Kan Urged 
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Japanese Prime Minister Naoto Kan admitted Friday that his fund management body received donations from a south Korean resident in Japan. 
					 Major Japanese daily the Yomiuri Shimbun reported in its morning edition Friday that Kan's fund management body received a total of 1.04 million yen in donations from 2006 to 2009 from a man who was a former board member of a south Korean-affiliated financial institution.
					
					 Kan said in parliament that he was ''totally unaware'' that the donor was a foreign national and he does not intend to resign as premier over the donations.
					
					 The Liberal Democratic Party and other opposition parties moved to intensify their offensive against him over the latest case.
					
					 LDP Vice President Tadamori Oshima told reporters that "it is shocking news", adding that now is the time for Kan "to clarify everything to the people, apologize and own the responsibility for it."

articles.title: Japanese PM Admits DPJ in Trouble
articles.content:
Japanese PM Admits DPJ in Trouble
						
Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Japanese Prime Minister Naoto Kan admitted on Mar. 5 that the Democratic Party of Japan was in trouble.
					 On the same day he said that the party was driven to the worst phase since its foundation at the national meeting of secretary generals and election chiefs that opened at the party headquarters.

articles.title: Distrust in Japan's Regime Increases among Local Authorities
articles.content:
Distrust in Japan's Regime Increases among Local Authorities
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Local authorities of Japan are becoming increasingly vocal expressing distrust in the present regime of Japan.
					 75 percent of the respondents made a negative comment on the activities of the present regime, according to the poll conducted among officials of local self-governing bodies. 
					
					 87 percent of those polled urged the Democratic Party to reexamine its commitments made during the last elections to the House of Representatives.

articles.title: Japan Mulls Dispatch of More Troops Overseas
articles.content:
Japan Mulls Dispatch of More Troops Overseas
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- The Japanese authorities are mulling sending their more forces overseas under the pretence of their "active part" in the operations to be conducted with the cooperation of the international community, revealing their plan for overseas expansion.
					 According to NHK of Japan, the Japanese government is contemplating the dispatch of about 300 troops of the three services of the SDF with a transport ship and helicopter to the exercise for rescuing people from a natural disaster involving over 20 nations to be staged in Indonesia from Mar. 15.

articles.title: Japan's Corporate Bankruptcies Continue
articles.content:
Japan's Corporate Bankruptcies Continue
 Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Japanese business bodies go to bankruptcy in group owing to the serious economic stagnation. 
					 Tokyo Shoko Research showed on March 8 through its data that there were 987 corporate failures across Japan in February.

articles.title: Efforts of Asian Countries to Protect Forest and Ecological Environment

Efforts of Asian Countries to Protect Forest and Ecological Environment

articles.title: Kim Jong Il expresa condolencias por el deceso de Choe Ro Sa
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il expresa condolencias por el deceso de Choe Ro Sa
Pyongyang, 12 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio el dia 12 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro de la difunta Choe Ro Sa, poetisa veterana laureada con el Premio Kim Il Sung, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: ATCC comenta la hipocrita teoria de "dialogo"
articles.content:
ATCC comenta la hipocrita teoria de "dialogo"
						
Pyongyang, 12 de marzo (ATCC) -- "Estamos listos para dialogar cuandoquiera con el Norte con el alma abierta", dijo asi recientemente el mandatario surcoreano en un lugar publico.
					?Quien le haria caso si se recuerda que el llevo las relaciones intercoreanas a la peor fase?
					
					Todos saben que el actual gobernante surcoreano no perdio ninguna oportunidad para fingirse partidario de dialogo y paz.
					
					Tan pronto como tomara el poder, dijo que "esta abierta la puerta de dialogo en cualquier momento y dondequiera".
					
					En el proximo ano de su llegada al poder, dijo que "esta listo para iniciar el dialogo y la cooperacion sobre todos los problemas intercoreanos sin importar la fecha ni el nivel".
					
					En el ano pasado, preconizo que "hay que tomar como meta la reunificacion pacifica superando las circunstancias de division".
					
					En contraste con tales dichos, las autoridades surcoreanas dieron espaldas a la declaracion conjunta del gobierno, los partidos politicos y las entidades de la RPDC de sostener amplio dialogo y negociaciones con los partidos politicos y entidades surcoreanos, incluyendo sus autoridades, y a las sucesivas medidas tomadas este ano por ponerla en practica.
					
					Ademas, llevaron intencionalmente a la ruptura el dialogo previo para la apertura de conversaciones militares de alto nivel Norte-Sur hablando del "cambio de actitud".
					
					Esta conocido ya que despues de publicada la historica Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio cuyo nucleo es el ideal "Entre nosotros, los connacionales", se registraron uno tras otro en las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas los eventos sorprendentes e inimaginables en el pasado. A medida que se realizaban activamente el dialogo y los contactos entre las autoridades y entidades civiles de ambas partes, se abrio un hueco en la muralla de division, que separa a los coreanos del Norte y el Sur durante mas de medio siglo, y se dio buen impulso a la cooperacion por la prosperidad comun de la nacion coreana.
					
					Tales exitos, que infundian en la nacion coreana la esperanza y fe de la reunificacion, la paz y la prosperidad, se echaron por tierra cuando aparecio el  actual "poder" surcoreano.
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos no tienen desde el principio la voluntad sincera de dialogar con el Norte.
					
					Sin embargo, reclaman con palabras el dialogo porque no se atreven a desestimar la unanime demanda de los habitantes internos y externos sobre el desarrollo de las relaciones con el Norte.
					
					Por eso, los habitantes surcoreanos de diferentes sectores se burlan de ellos diciendo que el dialogo aludido por estos es una palabra ceremoniosa, protocolar y retorica para completar el texto de discursos.
					
					De mal en peor, el mandatario surcoreano hizo referencia al "dialogo" diciendo que el "Norte es de la misma nacion", justamente cuando libraba con las fuerzas extranjeras los ejercicios militares conjuntos para la agresion a la RPDC.
					
					Su canturreo vacio y repugnante sobre el "dialogo" constituye una burla y engano a los compatriotas.

articles.title: Azotan a Japon fuertes terremotos
articles.content:
Azotan a Japon fuertes terremotos
						
  Pyongyang, 12 de marzo (ATCC) -- El dia 11, un temblor de 8.8 grados en escala abierta de Richter ataco la region de Tohoku y vasta zona periferica de Japon.
					  De acuerdo con fuentes extranjeras, el maremoto de hasta 10 metros de altura inundo las tierras cultivables y carreteras de los departamentos litorales del Pacifico de ese pais y reboto hacia las costas las embarcaciones pesqueras, incluso grandes barcos cargueros.
					
					  En las costas de la ciudad de Sendai, se descubrieron casi 300 cadaveres de los que parecen ser ahogados en el mar.
					
					  Estan envueltos en llamas el deposito de petroleo del puerto Sendai y la refineria de Ichihara del departamento de Chiba, aparte del incendio forestal en el departamento de Miyagi.
					
					  Por otra parte, dejaron de funcionar las centrales atomicas y se interrumpio el suministro de electricidad a mas de 4 millones de familias en Tokio y su contorno.
					
					Se derrumbaron muchas viviendas y edificios publicos, se paralizo el transito de automoviles, trenes y aviones y se cortaron las redes de comunicaciones.
					
					NHK y otras cadenas japonesas se dedican ahora exclusivamente al reportaje sobre las perdidas del desastre natural.
					
					El gobierno japones convoco la reunion emergente de todos los ministros para consultar las medidas frente al temblor.
					
					Hasta la manana del dia 12, murieron mas de 570 y desaparecieron mas de 700.
					
					La inquietud se incrementa debido a las fuertes replicas que sacuden varias localidades de Japon, incluso la zona en el lado opuesto del epicentro del terremoto principal.
					
					Las fuentes extranjeras senalan que los terremotos y consiguientes tsunamis, de maxima dimension en la historia de observacion sismologica de Japon, escenifican un pandemonio desatando el panico.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun resalta caracter agresivo de ejercicios militares
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun resalta caracter agresivo de ejercicios militares
Pyongyang, 12 de marzo (ATCC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun publico este sabado un comentario individual cuyo texto resumido sigue abajo:
					El dia 10, quedaron concluidos parcialmente los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" iniciados el 28 de febrero en el suelo surcoreano.  Una parte de "Foal Eagle" se extendera hasta finales de abril. 
					
					Si se toma en cuenta el numero de efectivos y equipos belicos movilizados y el contenido de esas maniobras, resulta evidente que fueron peligrosos entrenamientos sin precedentes en la historia para la guerra de agresion a la RPDC.
					
					Sin embargo, los belicistas norteamericanos y surcoreanos enganan a la opinion publica interna y externa mintiendo que "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" son "ejercicios anuales de defensa". Esto no pasa de ser un sofisma descarado para ocultar su ambicion criminal de agredir a la RPDC y su genio belicista.
					
					Bajo el pretexto de hacer frente a la supuesta "situacion de emergencia", se ejercitaron en esas ocasiones el ataque sorpresivo y tridimensional contra la RPDC con todos los medios incluyendo armas nucleares.
					
					Seria una estupidez si EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas intentaran conseguir algo con la amenaza y presion militares a la RPDC.
					
					Ellos deben dejarse de locuras como meterse en el fuego con gasolina.?
